{{Use mdy dates|date=November 2016}} {{infobox comedian |name=Naveed Mahbub |nationality=Bangladeshi |alma_mater={{unbulleted list|[[Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology]]|[[University of Michigan, Ann Arbor]]}} | medium = {{flatlist| * Stand-up *television }} }}
'''Naveed Mahbub''' is a Bangladeshi comedian and columnist. He was awarded Best Male Comedian in the [[The Comedy Festival|2007 Las Vegas Comedy Festival]].<ref name=stand/> In 2016, Mahbub was featured in US-based comedy television channel [[Comedy Central]]. He hosts a morning radio show, ''Good Morning Bangladesh'', on [[ABC Radio (Bangladesh)|ABC Radio]].<ref name="cc">{{cite web | url=http://www.thedailystar.net/arts-entertainment/tv/naveed-mahbub-comedy-central-1302289 | title=Naveed Mahbub on Comedy Central | publisher=The Daily Star | date=October 22, 2016 | accessdate=October 22, 2016}}</ref> He writes articles on the newspaper [[The Daily Star (Bangladesh)|The Daily Star]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://archive.thedailystar.net/beta2/columnists/naveed-mahbub/ | title=Naveed Mahbub | publisher=The Daily Star | accessdate=October 21, 2016}}</ref>
==Education== Mahbub completed his bachelor's in electrical engineering from [[Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology]] and master's from the [[University of Michigan, Ann Arbor]].<ref name=stand>{{cite web | url=http://www.thedailystar.net/news-detail-26426 | title=Naveed Mahbub and his stand-up comedy | date=March 7, 2008 | accessdate=October 21, 2016 | author=Mahboob, Mahdin}}</ref> While he was an MBA student at the [[University of California, Berkeley]], he took a course in the Sandi Shore's Standup Comedy Workshop.<ref name=stand/>
==Career== For 13 years, Mahbub served as an engineer at [[Ford Motor Company]], [[Kyocera Wireless]] and [[Qualcomm]] in the United States and the CEO of IBM and Nokia Siemens Networks Bangladesh.<ref name=stand/><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.thedailystar.net/author/naveed-mahbub | title=Naveed Mahbub | work=The Daily Star | accessdate=October 21, 2016}}</ref>
Mahbub had performed as a stand-up comic in the United States in the 2000s. He returned to Bangladesh in 2009. He founded the country's first comedy club, ''Naveed's Comedy Club'' in 2010.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.thedailystar.net/lifestyle/thank-god-its-friday/thank-god-its-friday-124183 | title=Thank God It's Friday | publisher=The Daily Star | date=August 11, 2015 | accessdate=October 21, 2016 | author=Ditan, Tanziral}}</ref>
Since June 2012, Mahbub hosted a [[late night television]] talk show ''"Grameenphone Presents â€“ The Naveed Mahbub Show"''.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.thedailystar.net/news-detail-236479 | title=The Naveed Mahbub Show on ntv | publisher=The Daily Star | date=June 1, 2012 | accessdate=October 21, 2016}}</ref>
He acted in a small role in the film ''[[You Don't Mess with the Zohan]]'', featuring [[Adam Sandler]] and [[Rob Schneider]].<ref name=stand/>
==Books== * ''Humorously Yours and Counting'' (2015)<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.thedailystar.net/city/dhaka-lit-fest-begins-175285 | title=Dhaka Lit Fest begins | publisher=The Daily Star | date=November 20, 2015 | accessdate=October 21, 2016}}</ref>
